entries.title: Combined summary - How to evaluate block size increase suggestions.
entries.summary: The debate over increasing the block size for Bitcoin has led to various proposals, but Emin Gün Sirer asks a more fundamental question: what are the grand goals that a truly perfect function would achieve? Rather than debating specific block size increase functions, Sirer suggests meta-goals such as increasing the block size while ensuring that large miners never have an advantage over small miners that they did not have in the preceding 6 months or increasing block size as much as possible subject to the constraint that 90% of the nodes on the network are no more than 1 minute behind one of the tails of the blockchain 99% of the time.
